intro: Lindernia spathacea, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
